text: Elena Savoldi (born 11 November 1972) is a former professional tennis player from Italy. ==Biography== Savoldi, who comes from Brescia, began her career on the ITF circuit in 1990. At the 1991 Mediterranean Games in Athens she won a silver medal in the women's doubles event, partnering Francesca Romano. She reached a career high singles ranking of 134 on the professional tour, with her best WTA Tour performances including a third round appearance at the 1993 Italian Open and a win over Miriam Oremans to make the round of 16 at Taranto in 1994. On the ITF circuit she won six singles titles. It was as a doubles player that she made her only grand slam main draw appearance, at the 1994 US Open with partner Susanna Attili. ==ITF finals== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:85%;" width=15% |- style="background:#f7e98e;" | $75,000 tournaments |- style="background:lightblue;" | $25,000 tournaments |- style="background:#f0f8ff;" | $10,000 tournaments |} ===Singles (6-1)=== {| class="sortable wikitable" style="font-size:97%;" !Outcome !No. !Date !Tournament !Surface !Opponent !Score |-bgcolor="#f0f8ff" | style="background:#98fb98;"|Winner | 1. | 12 January 1992 | Woodlands, United States | Hard | Iva Majoli | 6–4, 6–4 |-bgcolor="#f0f8ff" | style="background:#98fb98;"|Winner | 2. | 8 March 1992 | Granada, Spain | Hard | Antonela Voina | 7–5, 7–6 |-bgcolor="#f0f8ff" | style="background:#98fb98;"|Winner | 3. | 11 January 1993 | Bergen, Norway | Carpet | Svetlana Komleva | 6–2, 6–3 |-bgcolor="#f0f8ff" | style="background:#98fb98;"|Winner | 4. | 18 January 1993 | Helsinki, Finland | Carpet | Maria Ekstrand | 6–2, 6–0 |- style="background:lightblue;" | style="background:#98fb98;"|Winner | 5. | 22 February 1993 | Valencia, Spain | Hard | Federica Bonsignori | 6–4, 6–1 |- style="background:lightblue;" | style="background:#98fb98;"|Winner | 6. | 8 August 1993 | Winnipeg, Canada | Hard | Luanne Spadea | 6–2, 6–4 |- bgcolor="lightblue" | bgcolor="FFA07A"|Runner-up | 1. | 28 January 1998 | Mission, United States | Hard | Karin Miller | 3–6, 5–7 |} ===Doubles (4–4)=== {|class="sortable wikitable" style=font-size:97% |- !
